Reviews.Title: Died in less than 1 week
Reviews.Author: J. Musiak
Reviews.Content: The Amazon reviews were all pretty good, so I gave it a try.  It arrived quickly, and the picture quality looked good.  After using it for less than 1 week, the picture went completely black.  The sound worked, but no picture.  I searched for Sceptre Reviews, and found a major retail store that had over 100 reviews for this TV.  I looked at the 1 star reviews, and saw at least 10 referencing the exact same problem.  It must be a design flaw.You might get lucky and get a good one, but I was not willing to risk sending mine back for repair.  Thanks to Amazon for their great customer service.  I sent it back and got a full refund!

Reviews.Title: Not bad at all for the $
Reviews.Author: Charles E.
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these TVs for the bedrooms. Paid $207 shipped for each one so the deal was incredible and it allows me to use it as a monitor as well as a TV so this is a great space saver when you combine it with a low profile wall mount. Simple setup with HDMI inputs allowed for the TV to be up and running in no time at all. The 1080p image is clear and crisp. I have seen other 240hz 1080P TV's that don't match up in video quality. You do need to tweak the settings a bit to get the most out of the video but if you invest 3 minutes the image is a 8.5 out of 10 which is great for the price. The sound is the only downside as others have stated. I don't think that the sound would cut it in a larger living room but for a bedroom TV you really can't go wrong.Very happy with my purchase so far!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this TV!
Reviews.Author: Coffee Drinker
Reviews.Content: I've had this about 3 months and couldn't be more pleased! Picture and Color are very good! The sound could be alittle better but for a bedroom TV its perfect. Then again the sound on all models and brands don't impress me. For a no name TV I took a chance with I'm pleased!

Reviews.Title: CAUTION -- 3.5mm (headphone) sound output does NOT work properly!
Reviews.Author: GaHillBilly "GaHillBilly"
Reviews.Content: I just ordered one of these a week ago and quickly found that the TV had a loud hum in the 3.5mm (headphone) sound output. The replacement, received today, had the same problem. I tested the headphone jack on both TVs with multiple speaker sets and a headphone set.Since I'd planned to use a set of Bose PC speakers with the TV, to overcome the reported poor built-in speakers, this was quite irritating. I can confirm that the built-in speakers did work, but were as poor quality as reported elsewhere.When I received the original TV, the online 'chat' service person was unhelpful. But today, I reached a live Sceptre service person, who suggested using the RCA sound output instead. And, after buying the right cables ($6 here, but $12 at the local Radio Shack) it now works fine.Obviously, if you don't plan to use the headphone output, this problem doesn't matter. But, if you do, be sure to ALSO order an RCA to 3.5mm female cable, along with the TV. If you buy at the same time as the TV, you can get the cable you need for $3 - $6.

Reviews.Title: Recommended Low-End LCD
Reviews.Author: Elliot Lear
Reviews.Content: A friend sent me the link to this TV during cyber monday week and I decided to take the plunge. I saw a few reviews talking about how the TV died shortly after they had received it, but figured for $180 and with Amazon's great return service, I would take the risk. I'm so glad I did!I've had it for a week and it's going strong, so I'm not sure if some of Sceptre's TVs were made incorrectly but are still in stock at Amazon? I guess just be aware that there are "duds" out there, but in my personal case, it's working fine. The screen is typical of an LCD system: if there's a lot of light in the room, it can be a bit too reflective. However, I usually watch the TV in the dark so it's not an issue, and even with some lights on, it's hardly that detrimental. Certainly nothing to quibble over at this price point.The 1080p is picture-perfect! I was a little hesitant about buying a TV online and not being able to preview the screen in store: as we all know, there are some TVs at 720p that look better than 1080p due to a variety of factors, so going to a brick and mortar can be helpful in choosing a set that meets customer standards. But there was no need to fear here, for the picture is clear and not too "digitized." I also have a 46" LG 1080p which out of the box required a lot of fiddling with picture quality settings to be watchable: the trigger sensing made all movies look ridiculous. Not so here. The TV also has a handy picture button on the remote, where one can cycle through power saving mode (the lowest light setting) to vivid for HD content. If I'm watching a BD, I set it to vivid; a DVD, power saving so that the up-converting isn't too obvious of lesser quality.The one down side? The headphone jack doesn't work. I know this was mentioned in another review, but when listening on headphones there's a loud, consistent hum. The sound quality on the set is pretty low quality, but still very listenable. I don't know what some people expect from the sound on a lowrange LCD, but this met expectations and is not overly tinny or hard to hear. It's simply not a high quality setup. I took the advice of another reviewer on the headphone issue, though: buy an RCA-3.5mm cable, plug the male end into the red and white audio outputs and your headphones into the female cable. Works like a charm.All in all, I'm very happy with the set and the price can't be beat. Though $179 made it impossible not to jump at this TV, even at its current price of $220 the Sceptre is a steal.

Reviews.Title: Nice overall
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV it has 1080p and a great price point at 199 for a 32 inch. What else could you ask for great price good picture and good sound.

Reviews.Title: Only issue is the sound.
Reviews.Author: Wetzel
Reviews.Content: I own this one and the 40 inch one and love both of them. However, the sound really does not get that loud. I added some speakers and now it's awesome.  Anything less then 32" is just too small for me and of course 1080p is noticeably better in my opinion then 720, common sense right. The negative reviews claim that they break fast and I don't doubt that it's a cheap tv, however I have owned three, sold two and still have the 40", going on 7 months and it's working great. Take the risk as amazon customer service is very good and will refund. I'd give 5 stars if the sound was better.Sceptre also gives you a screw driver!!! Not saying that's why I bought the tv, but damn it beats running around looking for one lol. Buy this tv is you are as cheap as me!

Reviews.Title: Not a bad deal but...no.....
Reviews.Author: Craytose
Reviews.Content: I ordered this because of the price, if you want an actual good picture I would advise against it.  I fiddled with settings for days, I consider myself a pretty advanced techie, and I just could not get it to a level where it satisfied me at all.  Returned the TWO I bought (so it's extremely unlikely that it was just a defective pair) and grabbed some more insignias, for price and picture ratio, you just can't go wrong with them imo.  It's not a bad product necessarily, but if you're used to really vibrant colors and a really clear HD picture, you're going to be disappointed with this Sceptre.

Reviews.Title: So far, flawless HDTV
Reviews.Author: Leon
Reviews.Content: Couldn't say enough good things about this TV.  Price, image quality, sound.  Compared to the big brands, its got all they offer plus the cheap price tag.

Reviews.Title: Great resolution bad audio
Reviews.Author: Ajax
Reviews.Content: The picture and resolution are fantastic.2 things come to mind about the sound.Sounds as nice as one of those $8 clock radios you find in motels. Nice and tinny.Like those Black and Decker drills of 15 years ago with 6" cord. You have to buy something else to make it useful, like a theater system.You can play with the audio settings and get it good enough for a small bedroom.I'd get a Vizio if I had an extra $100I would give a 3.5 as is and 5.0 if it sounded as good as it looks.

Reviews.Title: Screen dies after 6 month
Reviews.Author: Dong Hoon Sin
Reviews.Content: It has been 6month and the screen is gone. Tv indicated power is on but screen is not turned on.  I would not recommend this product

Reviews.Title: I don't know yet
Reviews.Author: Happy Gregg Jr.
Reviews.Content: recieved the package fine this was going to be a Christmas present for my 10 yr old that had asked for a TV, I ordered it just after Thanksgiving. On Christmas Day I had a super happy 10 yr old that got a good looking tv, we plugged it in and put batteries in remote to turn it on pressed power nothing happened no blinking lights no nothing. We called and left messages by phone and emailed we were contacted the next day which was fine. The tech that called determined it was a power issue and the tv had to be sent back but we were going to have to put up a $300 deposit. We sent the paperwork in last night along with a $300 non-charged deposit on a CC, they could only say it could take up to 30 days to handle this issue. I will let you know later how it works out. Beleive it or not we got a replacemet TV about a month later guess what It didn't work eather. This time I call and gave them HELL we received our 3rd TV about 2 weeks later and THIS ONE WORKED. Just be careful when purchasing this item.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Gomer 42k
Reviews.Content: Good:  this tv has a good picture, not quite up to the samsung standard, but quite good.  It typically is available at half the price of the samsung version, so this makes it a compromise buy.  I ditched my old tube tv for this, and havent had any regrets...  the HDTV channels are fairly clear and crisp, the colors and brightness are user controlled, and movies through netflix and amazon are quite good, esp compared to the old "tube" tv.  I have no regrets.  they are charging the correct amount for this, it is not overpriced.Bad:  the remote did not work as delivered.  Sceptre has "no" customer service.  I finally got some satisfaction via Amazon customer service.  Sceptre does not return calls or emails.  Worst customer service there is.  Hope you dont have any issue.  Wouldnt be surprised to see  Amazon drop them as a supplier.  Not sure why they publish their contact info, it is a black hole.  If you find a TV for similar price from any other supplier, take it and avoid Sceptre.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Kizuna
Reviews.Content: This is one of the greatest TVs I have ever owned! The only issue I have with it, or rather, the only complaint I have about it, is that it wobbles a little bit on the stand... as if it isn't very sturdy. It is a great TV otherwise. I have all the screwed tightened entirely, and every screw in the stand and attached to the TV, it just isn't very stable it seems. Again, otherwise it works great! I have my computer and Wii hooked up to it currently, and I couldn't be more pleased with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for a great price!
Reviews.Author: happycustomer
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely happy with this tv! Great value! I got this for $220 and the picture is flawless! The only thing is the sound isn't all that great but I use surround sound speakers anyway so it doesn't even matter.

Reviews.Title: Bad TV
Reviews.Author: ELGuitara
Reviews.Content: Well, the TV died within the first 10 minutes. So, I can't really tell you how great it works, however, for those 10 minutes, it was good. Jajaja Like others before me have said, it's hit or miss when you buy one of these TVs. Some haven't had issues, some have. The good thing is, they have not given me any problems about taking it back, though, they won't cover the shipping charges. So, buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: don't bother if you don't have speakers
Reviews.Author: Rob B.
Reviews.Content: The speakers have a buzz even at low volume.  I use my headphones and it works fine and has a nice picture.  It was cheap and it works for my use which is the only reason I didn't return it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, horrible sound
Reviews.Author: JMon "MPLS_gadgeteer"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good...bright and sharp.  Sound quality is awful.  Tinny with no bass and questionable mid range.  Are there only the world's cheapest tweeters in this TV?  I will be looking for other audio for this set either an old stereo or a new soundbar.  I got a great deal from Amazon, just under $180 so I am keeping it.  But Sceptre really dropped the ball on the onboard audio.BTW, I am a bit of an amateur audiophile so your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: WOW SUPER FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: Eric S. Clark
Reviews.Content: WOW I know I said that already but that just keeps coming to mind when I think about this TV. I ordered this TV as a monitor first and as a TV second so I am very pleased as to what my new monitor looks like. I had brought a Samsung before on Black Friday for about 350 from Best Buy but was not happy with it for several reasons, one of the main ones is that it did not have a VGA port (OK blame me I did not check before I left the store). Nevertheless this one has one and as far as I am concerned it has just as good a picture as the Samsung. Another thing with the Samsung is that it only had 2 HDMI ports what a waste. But the main reason I am writing this review is because the picture was awful on the overpriced Samsung but on this 180 buck Sceptre it is all that I would want it to be . So if you are like I was looking for a cheaper TV to use as a monitor this might be just the trick for you and it is 1080p which is as well just what I was looking for. Oh let me say this as well the Samsung even at the price that it was did not have a swivel base but this one does so that is another major plus other than the price of course. I could go on all day talking about my new monitor but let me just say this, buy it and you will not be disappointed if you are like me you will be blown away as I was and still am. Now also I need say this I did buy the coverage plan because the one question that is still on my mind is how long will it last, I hope for more that the 3 years that the coverage plan covers but that part is still left to be seen. Oh that is right others are complaining about the sound well since I am using it as a monitor the sounds works great for me I even had the turn it down some so for me this TV is all good, buy two I know I wish I had!

Reviews.Title: Not bad. I haven`t got to use HD yet.
Reviews.Author: ReviewsFoReal
Reviews.Content: I like how the tv looks, easy to set up if you know where the cords go, and even had a screwdriver to put the screws in for the stand!I wish the 480i quality was better but thats what i get because i bought a HDTV not a console tv so i hope to upgrade to hd soon. Great product!

Reviews.Title: Great product for great price
Reviews.Author: mrmamlohifoou
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for a Guest/Study room and it couldn't be more perfect. The screen is clear and gives a beautiful picture. For an off brand TV it is really worth the price. I hook it up to my cable and have a toggle for my Laptop, and it moves seamlessly to either.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Scrupt
Reviews.Content: before i bought this tv i read alot of negative thing about this particular brand i don't know what their problems were but i can't be more happier with this brand

Reviews.Title: The best purchase I've made.
Reviews.Author: Roont
Reviews.Content: I really wasn't looking to buy an HD TV, since I already have a 32" 720p. When I saw this on Cyber Monday for $179, I couldn't NOT buy it. Now that I've tried it out, I can hardly believe what a good deal it was.How I use it: Currently it's connected to my laptop so I can watch videos/movies by using it as a 2nd monitor and still use my laptop screen at the same time. When I have a desktop computer and a computer desk, this 1080p TV and the 720p TV I already have will work as dual monitors.Image Quality: 1080p resolution is great because there's no noticeable pixelation even when using it as a computer monitor (which is not always true for 720p). The color is SUPERB. The color and brightness on this TV actually produce a prettier image than theater projectors IMO. And the blacks are DARK. When displaying black, it's hardly lighter than when turned off. It's also worth mentioning that the screen is lit extremely evenly. My 720p LED TV has a glow around the edges which is mostly noticeable when displaying a lot of black. On the Sceptre, every pixel is evenly lit with no distortion whatsoever.Sound: It doesn't sound like a speaker system, it sounds like a TV. My 720p Vizio is in the $350 range and has quality HD sound, but its also in another price/resolution category. At the time I'm writing this review, the Sceptre 1080p 32" can be found on Walmart.com for $198. You can invest the extra $150 and get an HD 5.1 surround sound system here on Amazon., or an HD sound bar if you don't want all that hassle.In summary, this is a great TV and computer monitor. If you can get it for less than $220, you're getting quite nearly the best value on a consumer media device you can find.

Reviews.Title: I would not purchase again
Reviews.Author: Nick B "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these televisions and have had issues with both of them.  The first one I bought had a problem in the sound system.  You could not hear the television in a very small room.  Finally, the power supply ceased to function leaving the screen black.  The 2nd television has speaker rattle, similar to a blown speaker.  The power light also flickers on and off.  I purchased an LG for more money to replace these televisions, and the LG is worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Stopped turning on and terrible sound, (less than a yea)
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Lowe
Reviews.Content: We had purchased this to replace a very old bedroom TV and figured anything would be an upgrade.. Although there was a large number of reviews pointing out the terrible sound, we thought it wouldn't be an issue with us due to having a smaller bedroom.  Turned out it really was horrible, and it sounded like you were listening to a TV that was in another room or through the walls.. We had done some research and learned the sound could be somewhat adjusted if we changed the preference setting to jazz, which helped a little.. The main issue we had was within a month or so, when the TV started turning on slower and slower every day. It got to the point that it wouldn't turn on at all, and we were forced to unplug and plug repeatedly while holding our breath.. As it got worse and worse, we decided to keep the TV on all day 24/7 fearing it would not come back on. Then one day my wife turned it off by accident, pffffttt, never came on again.. Once again we had done some research and learned that many others have experienced this problem, and they were going in circles to get it fixed.. I thought maybe I had gotten a lemon until I saw the long list of similar complaints..  It has been a headache since day one with this TV, and I wish it on no one..

Reviews.Title: Do Not Waste Your Money
Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: Wow!  I bought two of these for use in my department for video conferences and product data displays.  In less than 9 months I've had to repair one of these twice.  The other one just went out as well.  So, 3 repairs in 9 months.  DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY ON THESE.  Spend a little extra and buy a Samsung or Sony.

Reviews.Title: On/Off Stopped working after about 8 months
Reviews.Author: Joe R. Gibbens
Reviews.Content: The on/off switch stopped working after about 8 months.  Won't work manual or by remote.  It's a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Do yourself a HUGE favor and get a different TV
Reviews.Author: AdmiralTugBenson
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with the picture on this TV, or anything like that, they just break almost on cue.  In dealing with my problem with the TV I've ran into countless others on the internet who have had similar problems, the TV just dying on them.  Whatever it is apparently is a known problem they just haven't bothered to fix.  And on top of that, their customer service people are shady.  Since mine went out after 7 months it was still under warranty, but their customer service people told me to try a couple of things that I later found out were temporary fixes and that this is a known problem, and then assured me the TV was fine, but it wasn't.  They were just trying to get it past the warranty date.  But now that I've actually set up a repair (they won't replace, just repair) they are still giving me the runaround.  It's been 2 weeks since this thing died on me and they still haven't even sent me the box to ship it back to them in, because they say they have run out of boxes.  2 weeks and I haven't even been able to send it back yet, who knows how long it will be before I ever get the thing back.  By the time I do get it back the warranty will probably have expired and if it still has problems I'll just be stuck with it.  I know the price is right on this thing, and not every single model has broken, but you should do yourself a favor and look for another brand.  Steer clear of Sceptre at all costs.

Reviews.Title: Fun won't last long..
Reviews.Author: carpitol "carpitol"
Reviews.Content: It was nice while it lasted but it didn't last even 6 months. Now I need to work to get it replaced by warranty..

Reviews.Title: Great start but doesn't last
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv 9 months ago as a gift for my husband it the last 2 weeks half the time the tv doesn't turn on and about 50% of that time we have no volume! So buyers beware! It's a great tv to start but doesn't last long!

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY IT!  RETURNED 2 TIMES IN 6 MONTHS FOR SERVICE.
Reviews.Author: Joe Gilbert Lopez Jr
Reviews.Content: This looks like a great deal because of the cost, and all the bad reviews don't appear.  You have 60 days from purchase to return it to Amazon.  If it breaks after that like it did for me in the 3rd month, then you have to have the box mailed to you then you have to mail it back Sceptre for repair.  This is twice that (per the IT tech who came and looked at it) the brains are dead.  My elderly mother now has to be without a TV once again because there is no picture, sound, nada.  Good luck in getting a replacement TV.  I was told that there are 3 main components to this TV.  Well one has been replaced, the second one is about to be replaced.  The warranty expires now in 2 months.  That leaves one component left to go out and warranty expired.  Bad Buy.  Amazed that Amazon even does business with this company.  Leaves a bad taste in your mouth.  Good customer and then this.  Sorry Amazon, you let me down also.

Reviews.Title: Good at first...
Reviews.Author: StealthyBurrito
Reviews.Content: At first this TV was the best thing I bought, especially since I got it on cyber monday, so I saved quite a bit. First few months were great with some minor irritations. Then the TV started to ignore that I was trying to change sources. Somehow though it fixed itself from doing that. So all was good again, or so I thought. It then started to work only when it was convenient for itself to work. By this I mean that no matter where it was plugged into it would have the blue LED light indicating that it was going to turn on, and then it would freeze. For a short while (1-2 weeks) this could be resolved by unplugging and replugging the TV back in multiple times and hope it would work. Now? Now, it's dead.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed / Disgusted
Reviews.Author: Video Corporation of America
Reviews.Content: I had the TV less than 6 months and it just stopped working.  Took it to the repair shop and they said that it cannot be repaired.What a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: TV barely made it one year before it quit working
Reviews.Author: sarah
Reviews.Content: If you are going to buy a cheap TV you had better plan on getting the warranty as well.  Not saying that will guarantee you get a replacement, but all tv's this price are cheaply made

Reviews.Title: DIED After 6 Months
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: On the first day of the 6th month, the TV started hesitating to turn on. About a week later, the device will not power on at all. No help from the seller. I discourage buying this. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre Worst Tv Ever ..Please Google Sceptre Won't Turn on...Run Away Don't Buy This Tv. !!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Royston
Reviews.Content: This tv stopped working in 3 months , just out of 208.00 dollars I wish I could have gotten this info.... it cut's it self off and to get it repaired it's over the price you paid for it and of course, I can't return it because the return date is just a month after you buy it.... I don't want anybody else to end up with this tv ...just google this tv....  sceptre wont turn on and see all the problems if I can stop 1 person from buying this tv and saving them the problems I had ...they know it's a glitch with their television...don't buy it...

Reviews.Title: WARNING: DO NOT BE TRICKED
Reviews.Author: dwolf47
Reviews.Content: "WARNING: DO NOT BE TRICKED". This TV WILL break within 6 months, if you make it a year you are lucky. It is under warranty BUT you will spend several hundred dollars having it shipped to California unless you live right there.

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy ! TV WONT TURN ON!!!-
Reviews.Author: TJM
Reviews.Content: I bought my tv in NOvemeber 2012 and I have not had it a full year yet and it has already stopped working.I have done nothing to it , it just all of a sudden will not show video at all.I have a warrenty for a full year and yet still nothing is being done and I already contacted Sceptre.If you want a tv that will last long don't buy this one!!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the $200
Reviews.Author: Jyre
Reviews.Content: Thought it was a great price and do the company a favor & try it out, because thats how small clmanys become bug reputable ones right? It worked but not great.... The signal is okay between the TV & remote, and oh yeah I forgot! After only a year & 2 weeks the POS screen blows out, sound still works. Don't buy it! The Spectre website even has that as a troubleshooting problem, then the warranty is only a year long- just long enough to get THEIR money's worth out of you & make you pay for the repairs. Invest in a Sony, Sanyo, Samsung or Magnavox because obviously those people give a rat's behind about customer quality.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: James Montgomery "James Montgomery"
Reviews.Content: TV failed (would not turn on) within 5 months.....avoid this brand. Web site was no help....does not even list this model

Reviews.Title: I might love it
Reviews.Author: Art By Dezign
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific deal and I am very happy with it so far. The jury is still out -I will wait to make sure it performs as well as it does now, over time.It was easy to set up, has an easy to follow manual (a huge plus) that is not a straight electronic translation from a foreign language, and they do have live support help that will call you back, albeit it might take couple days. I figured out the small problem I had, myself, before they got back with me.

Reviews.Title: Cheap TV... Cheap components. You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: William M. Mccarter
Reviews.Content: TV has all the hookups that you would expect out of an HDTV, the positives tend to run out there.The speakers are the worst part of this television, for one thing, they are not able to get very loud, limiting its use to (as far as I'm concerned) maybe a medium sized bedroom. And the speakers, when subjected to certain frequencies, create a buzzing sound that resonates at a very unpleasant tone.Also, it is very difficult to get the proper aspect ratio for some standard-def channels. Much is lost doing so, and the 'zoom' level is only adjustable between a few 'hard settings' and even after RTFM I wasn't able to determine a custom-zoom option.So if you are able to hook this TV into a sound system & plan to view HD only content, the negatives are all but allayed from my experience.

Reviews.Title: Great HDtv for a low price.From prize to bomb.
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my son's xbox, and so far it has performed quite well. The picture and sound quality are very nice for the price. (01AUG13) It has now been a few months since I had written my original review... This tv is not worth the money, period. From the start there was a dead pixel in the lower left-hand corner (which I could overlook), but now the tv will not even turn on. I apologize to anyone who may have refered to my review and bought this product.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price
Reviews.Author: Charles Coleman
Reviews.Content: Bought the tv for $189.00 in January of 2013, months after the "Black Friday" deals.  The so called deals of Black Friday included a 720p 32 inch tv for $179.00 (very limited supply)  I waited for a better deal and found one here, just two months later!  Where can you buy a 32 inch 1080p LCD TV for $189????  NO WHERE.  The sound has been fine, the picture quality is great.  This is a perfect tv for our guest area.  We have a 65 inch 1080p TV in our family room.  Both have great picture!Not sure if other people are having issues with their sound because of TV providers, but our Directv provider makes sound perfectly fine for a 32 inch TV.  Hope others have the luck we did!

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive flat screen
Reviews.Author: Andrew "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this was a great buy for the price I paid.  Sure, this isn't the top of the line tv with the newest and greatest features, but it is 1080p, has more hdmi ports than most other tvs at this price range and does the job.  I use it for my gaming system since my main other tv only has 2 hdmi ports and one of them stopped working.A lot of the other reviewers have stated that the sound is terrible/tiny, I would have to disagree.  I actually put the sound on to "4 or 6" when I watch in my room since I find it too loud, but that's probably because most people these days listen to music devices all day long and have poor hearing (wild unsubstantiated guess) or I just have super hearing, who knows.  It's more likely that it's due to placement, since this one is in my room and not in a living room.The one huge negative is the stand, it's made from cheap plastic and is wobbly and looks unstable.  It's unfortunate that a good tv comes with such a poorly designed stand.To summarize, if you are in need of an extra television set and don't want to pay top dollar, think about this one.

Reviews.Title: Fairly Good TV
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Everything works and the picture is fairly good.  No where close to my 50" Panasonic, but then I spent a lot more on that one. The build of it does seem a little cheap and my remote doesn't put out a very strong signal.  Still it match the price tag in value.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: lisa beee
Reviews.Content: great buy ... put it all together finally..go the HD hooked up....the power cord i must say is too short. will be looking for a replacement shortly.... but other than that..excellent so far...bravo!

Reviews.Title: Love thiis TV
Reviews.Author: Deanna
Reviews.Content: my son loved this tv so much I bought another one for my daughters room . I would highly recommend !!!

Reviews.Title: decent tv
Reviews.Author: Matt Reeves
Reviews.Content: Pretty good for the price.  Speakers in the back make it sound a little muffled but that's about it.  Good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Would buy it again
Reviews.Author: P. Bradley
Reviews.Content: ... and probably will! We got this during a Christmas sale for our bedroom and I just got it mounted to the wall using the VideoSecu LCD LED TV Wall Mount. We also don't have cable television since spending $120 for nonsense on cable just didn't seem to be us anymore. The Sceptre found over 130 over-the-air stations with no problem. The picture clarity is great but you can also adjust that from a few pre-sets, plus do your own manual settings such as brightness, contrast, etc. Definitely worth the money and I'll be buying another one very soon for another bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: ack
Reviews.Content: Great value for the priceNo problem as such, it's been more than month and is working good so far.

Reviews.Title: A deal, but not a steal.
Reviews.Author: Russell D. Watts
Reviews.Content: Going in I had medium expectations.  For a couple hundred bucks, you get what you pay for.Pro: Cost, Picture is good, attractive profile, plenty of inputsCons: Speaker quality is a joke (expected), stand is very cheap and flimsy (sorta expected)You will need a separate sound system, even if its in a quiet bedroom.  Got pretty much what I expected so 4 stars, however one taken off for SUPER flimsy stand.

Reviews.Title: very satisified!
Reviews.Author: kemaya
Reviews.Content: I've had my tv for about a good three weeks and i am very satisfied. The sound isn't as bad as other people have complained. The picture quality is amazing and it works just fine for such a low price. Overall i love the tv. Its worth it!

Reviews.Title: Forget the $200 24-inch monitor- get THIS for your PC!
Reviews.Author: Carsten E Ramcke
Reviews.Content: I picked up this television to replace a 22-inch flat screen monitor for my computer.  I use said computer primarily to play World of Warcraft and other games, including simulations.  On a budget video card (sub $200 range), the picture quality is very good, and for a price of $209 delivered, a much better value, in my opinion, than a monitor.  Granted, I find the larger pixels result in a slightly less crisp image, but other than that, this is a fine solution if a) you want to see a high level of detail, or b) your middle-aged eyes are starting to fail you, and you hate searching for the reading glasses every time you want to check something out on-line.  The television came with its own phillips screwdriver for attaching the base, and also included a cleaning cloth, both of which were a pleasant surprise.  I have yet to hook this up to a television signal, but the streaming movies I have previewed look excellent.  There are better televisions out there, but if your budget (or your application) limits your options, this model is well worth considering.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV at a good price
Reviews.Author: monkeyboy1570
Reviews.Content: When I was looking to buy a new HDTV to replace my ancient Toshiba, I looked at a lot of TVs, read a lot of reviews, and ended up buying this one for its combination of size, resolution, features, and decent reviews, both on Amazon and other sites on the web that do product reviews, First off, quite a few 32 inch TVs only support 720p, and of those that support 1080p, many are quite a bit more expensive, though price alone is not the only consideration. Besides supporting 1080p, I also like that this comes with 3 HDMI ports, a VGA with audio, USB, composite (RCA), component (RGB), audio L+R (RCA) out, SPDIF, an old style RF cable hookup so you can use a set top box or even an over-the-air antenna because the internal tuner is both digital and analog, and finally a headphone jack for private listening, The TV is easy to set up and the remote is easy to use. There are enough adjustments so getting the color right is fairly easy. There is a simple equalizer and some settings for the audio, and the sound is pretty good, but it does sound a lot better hooked up to an external sound system. The plastic stand is sturdy enough, and it swivels quite far, but it doesn't tilt. Though there is the option to wall mount it, some of the connections are in the back, facing downwards, so it shouldn't be too difficult to hook stuff up, except maybe the USB port which is in the back too. The remaining connectors are on one side of the TV and there are some button controls on the other. All in all, I am very satisfied with this TV. It may not be internet ready but I have it hooked up to my laptop, so I have the internet on my TV, and as a monitor, it sure beats my laptop screen for watching Youtube and streaming movies, TV shows, or anything that the web offers, Good price, nice features, decent quality... What more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom T.V.
Reviews.Author: Dandy Dan "Crash"
Reviews.Content: We have had a small 13" t.v. in out bedroom for about four or five years now, and thought it was pretty good to watch in the bedroom (actually we were only listening because the picture was too small to see).  We got our first flat screen t.v. (46") about three years ago and really enjoy the HD movies.  I saw this t.v. at Amazon and decided it was time for an upgrade.  I've never had a Sceptre, but so far this t.v. has been great.  I was very sceptical because many of the reviews were negative about bad experiences trying to assemble the stand, and also complained about the sound and a bad picture.  I have had this Sceptre t.v. for over three months now, and it stays on from the time we go to bed until we get up.  I think the sound is as good as any flat screen, and the assembly was also very easy.  I'm glad I didn't pay attention to those negative reviews, because I think I purchased a very good t.v., and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a t.v. for a smaller room or even a larger room for that matter.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality of picture
Reviews.Author: rk
Reviews.Content: Got for $220 and size enough and great for Bedroom. Connected computer via VGA and picture is good.At 15 feet, hard to read PC input letters, but should be excellent if you arr using as a monitor.With my integrated video card, it didn't recognize as 1920x1080, but was ok when i used another PC thathad a separate graphics card.The TV cable channels picture quality is perfect with 1080i HD TV service.I mounted the TV to Wall above the dresser-mirror and the TV sound quality was very much audible, whenthe dresser-mirror is at a little slant, not sure if it is because of the sound getting reflected off the mirrorfrom bottom TV speakers. Thinking the quality would be very much audible if you put a wood piece orsomething below the speakers area at an angle, so that sound is reaching the front instead of  being directeddownwards. Overall the TV works great. remote is user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: HDale
Reviews.Content: This TV is wonderful for any room. The price is great and it works great. The picture is very clear and the sound is great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture at a great price
Reviews.Author: Oldanalyst
Reviews.Content: There is little I can fault in this set except for the sound. The setup was flawless and easy and everything worked correctly the first time. There are numerous external connections which all worked well. The picture is excellent and the remote allows easy control over the various parameters you can control. For some reason, I could not initially seem to get the previous channel button to work. But now it works fine.We live in the country between 2 TV markets and we get many over-the-air channels, many in HD, and switching from external antenna to our DISH satellite is quite easy. Our previous set required an external tuner and we still have one set that requires a tuner. The Septre requires less of a signal than does the external tuner making reception of over-the-air channels quite reliable.The set does a good job of letting you know what resolution the channel is using and you can adjust the picture accordingly. I have read that the sound you get from most of these very thin sets is never as good as the sound you can get from the older sets which had larger speakers. This set has undistorted, reasonably good but not great sound. The 32" size is just right for our viewing space. Most of our viewing is done 6-8 feet away from the set. The angle at which you can view the screen is good and viewing in room light is excellent as is the picture contrast. I was able to easily carry this set around using one arm and the set it replaced (same screen size) required 2 people to move it out of the room. I certainly recommend you consider this set if you are looking for a set of this size. We have now coupled this set with a Septre sound bar which works quite well.

Reviews.Title: Audio Jack
Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: I really like the tv. The picture is really good and clear, but the audio jack has a very loud annoying buzz to it. It's probably just the one I bought but it is really disappointing because i wanted to hook it up to my sound system and now i cant.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, But
Reviews.Author: Jena
Reviews.Content: Picture is excellent, almost as fine as the most expensive sets.  The speakers are awful.  I hooked up a spare pair of used top quality computer speakers to the headphone jack.  I am now getting getting gorgeous sound out of this TV.

Reviews.Title: Come On Man...What's not to like?
Reviews.Author: u2mcf101
Reviews.Content: A fully featured 32" 1080P HDTV for under $180?  Are you kidding me?  I might buy one for every single room in the house, including that toilet room.  (I'm from another country)Granted, I bought it on Cyber Monday (Black Friday for people too lazy to put on pants)...tks jim kim.  I bought a similar TV (720P Haier) last year on Cyber Monday for $199 and thought it was the deal of the decade.  Boy was I wrong.  That's 20 bucks I'll never get back.Anyway, UPS delivered it safely and on time.  I opened the box and set it up in a very few minutes.  (They even give you a rubber handled screwdriver to attach the doggone stand - now, that's above and beyond in my book, mister.)  Please understand, this is not a long term evaluation, but after 10 days of sorta lots of occasional use, I'm putting a stake in the ground and declaring it a great value.I know what you're thinking. This brand name is completely unknown to me.  Plus, way more importantly, it might not impress your friends and neighbors who only own Sony's or Samsung's.Well, my neighbors aren't laughing anymore.  I printed out the logo from a better known manufacturer and scotch taped it over the Spector..oops, Sceptre logo on the front of the TV.No one has even noticed.  I pretty sure they're laughing and pointing at Tina Fey on 30 Rock.  ..or Leno or whatever.

Reviews.Title: save your money...
Reviews.Author: indub
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv during cyber week and i have to say.. save your money.. i did get it in a quick and timely manor.. but it only worked for a day and a half and went completely black.. it wasn't an issue with the power either.. the power indicator was on.. but no sound or picture came from it.. as well as when i was watching the tv when i did have it working, the picture was fuzzy.. i wish you luck if you did purchase it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE!!!
Reviews.Author: sch.914
Reviews.Content: I JUST PURCHASED THIS TV. THE PRICE POINT WAS THE REASON I BOUGHT IT. I WAS SURPRISED TO FIND THE QUALITYAS GOOD AS MY VIZIO. I HAD HOOKED UP THE WIRES WRONG AND CALLED SUPPORT. THEY ANSWERED THE PHONE RIGHT AWAY AND WE FIXED THE PROBLEM IN TWO MINUTES!! THE PICTURE IS CLEAR AND THE SOUND IS GOOD TOO. EASY SETUP. I'M GLAD I DIDN'T SPEND THE EXTRA $100 ON A NAME BRAND. THIS IS A 5 STAR REVIEW!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe the price when I purchased this television and was blown away by the product, overall. Although the packaging wasn't up to my standards (was sent in just the tv box), the product works flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product/Packaging
Reviews.Author: Josh B
Reviews.Content: I was already impressed with the product before I turned it on.  It comes with screwed on based, complete with a mini screwdriver. Also included, a resealable zip lock bag, a screen cleaning cloth, and batteries for the very nice remote.  The clear and colored labels on the back made hooking this up to be easy.  Very clear picture and sound too.

Reviews.Title: No picture or sound after only a year
Reviews.Author: Donna Anding
Reviews.Content: Thought it was a great deal until it just quit working. No damage to the item, It is in excellent condition except even when the power button is on, there is no picture or sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a bedroom
Reviews.Author: Frank Vigil
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for a bedroom, and it does the job just fine.  Picture is clear and it is holding up just fine.  (Admittedly, it is in a room where it doesn't get much use).  Some people had complained about the headphone jack not working well.  I am simply using a MONO (corded) earphone for private listening and it works just fine with that.  No complaints, good product, great price.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this TV.Right out of the box it had a dead pixel in the middle of the screen. After some use and rotating the screen the stand is quite wobbly and the tv leans to one side. The picture isn't any better either, I feel its rather dull and not very HD

Reviews.Title: Horrible picture!
Reviews.Author: Adrien T. Stevens
Reviews.Content: Bought this and had it shipped to our rental property. When I finally got a chance to go to the condo and saw it... was HIGHLY disappointed. The picture quality is horrible... I was SO embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: VIKINGALUM00
Reviews.Content: The TV  stopped working after the one year return period had run. At first it would turn off on its own, then it wouldn't come on unless you unplugged it even though the power indicator showed that the TV  was on and finally it chose not to come on at all despite what the power indicator light showed. All of this happened less than 18 months of having the TV.

Reviews.Title: Never turn on again
Reviews.Author: Charlie Huang
Reviews.Content: Simply one month after a year, this TV set cannot be turned on. The screen keeps black while I tried thousands of times to plug/unplug it. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: piece of s***
Reviews.Author: M. Borucki "i know movies"
Reviews.Content: was kid of crappy from the start but now it take 5 times of powering it on and of to make it work

Reviews.Title: Works Pretty Well
Reviews.Author: Thomas G. Bassett
Reviews.Content: It's small, lightweight and works great for a simple personal TV.  The settings are somewhat unclear sometimes and it never plays my Playstation 3 in 1080p, but the picture quality when playing games or movies is great.  I paired it with a Bose Solo to get crystal clear sound as well.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre television
Reviews.Author: Martha
Reviews.Content: I could not have found a better television anywhere for the size and the price as this product.  Glad I ordered it.

Reviews.Title: waste of money (and time)
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M Faulkner
Reviews.Content: Originally bought this in Dec of 2012.  Completely failed (would not turn on at all) in Feb of 2013.  Amazon was able to exchange it for me no problem - I took a chance on a second one as it seemed the easiest way to go and I thought it might have just been a fluke.  Nope.  Same exact thing happened several months later.  The manufacturer was no help (in fact, could not even get anyone on the phone - I guess this brand is an offshoot of Sony, but like the poor man's version or something... customer service was non-existent).  Luckily, Amazon came through again (after MUCH ado, but it was past the return policy time frame) and issued me a credit so I could purchase a TV that didn't completely suck.  Amazon good, Sceptre bad.  The end.

Reviews.Title: 14 months later... and mine is dead now too.
Reviews.Author: Paul R.
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV 14 months ago and all of a sudden, it just won't power up.  Seems to be a common theme with many of the other reviewers stating the exact same situation - their TV is just barely out of the warranty period and now they're stuck with a 32" lemon.  Up until this point, it had been a perfectly serviceable bedroom television - but when I went to turn it on last night... no lights... no sound... just silence.  Rather disappointed by anything that fails just barely outside of the warranty period.  Tells you a lot about the quality testing (or lack thereof) that is done on these devices.  Made just good enough to last 12 months, but that's it.  Next time I'll spend the extra money for a TV with a real warranty.

Reviews.Title: Died in 14 Months
Reviews.Author: Scott Dalton
Reviews.Content: The audio in stunk from day one. It sounded like a 1960s transistor radio.The cable/broadcast TV sound was good though.Other than that, it worked fine for 13 months. Then it started acting up (it wouldn't turn on unless you unplugged it and retried several times). A month later it quit turning on altogether.

Reviews.Title: 13 months and still perfect
Reviews.Author: Micheal Brewer
Reviews.Content: for over a year, I have used this as a computer monitor for approximately 8 hours a day, and then additionally, as a TV for another 5 hours a day.  Still works perfectly.I have another in my bedroom that is used similarly, but for about a quarter of that amount of time, and it works perfectly as well.Great value.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FROM SCEPTRE
Reviews.Author: Dave Sideserf
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television about a year ago because the price appeared too good to be true. It was. The television completely died within 10 months and I had to return it to Sceptre to get it fixed. The television was repaired and returned to me 2.5 weeks later and worked fine for about another 3 months. After that, the television completely died again and because it is now over a year old, they are telling me my warranty is no longer valid. Do NOT buy from Sceptre. Save yourself the hassle and spend the extra $100 on a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Great price, looks great, sound is a little weak.
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: Concidering what I paid for this TV, I made out like a bandit!  You can tell the frame is probably made out of a cheaper material, but it has worked great from the moment it was turned on.  Just a heads up, the sound is pretty soft on this TV so it might not be a bad idea to pick up a simple sound system to go with it.

Reviews.Title: Ok, or sub par for a cheap TV
Reviews.Author: Luv2shop2much
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my teenage daughter to replace a old big TV so she could have a slim flat screen with all the hookups she needed for her wii & xbox.  It is ok for her, but I can tell a major difference in it compared to our $2000+ Sony & our other Plasma TVs & LED TV's by other brands.  But for her it is fine, for the price it was great.  You get what you pay for.  I just don't think it has a good quality picture, but she has never complained & we have had it about 14mths now & it still works, so that is a plus!

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Julianne Asbury
Reviews.Content: The product worked ok for about a year. The speakers are not very good, but the picture was fine. However, one day about a year after my purchase I went to watch a movie and it wouldn't turn on. No response at all from the TV. It was just completely dead. It has been on a wall mount - so it's not like it was tousled about or dropped. So really not worth it.

Reviews.Title: This is the worst product!!!
Reviews.Author: K.Christian
Reviews.Content: After one year, and now 15 days after the warranty ran out, the TV will not turn on. It was used very little over the course of the past year, and last night would not turn on at all. I strongly suggest that you spend a little extra get a better TV- this one is a piece of JUNK!!

Reviews.Title: The good news is that is died while under warranty.
Reviews.Author: Christine Gilbreath
Reviews.Content: The bad news was, well, it died.10 months it worked so-so. I should have sent it back the first time it turned on with a green and purple screen and no sound. Changing a channel would fix it so it didn't seem like more of a hassle than doing a return. Next Time I am doing the return first sign of problems. Now 10 months after purchase it is dead as dead could be - except for the little blue light that says it's on. The TV won't turn on and the blue light won't turn off until the set is unplugged. Ugh, now to deal with all the warranty stuff to get it returned or fixed.

Reviews.Title: Bad choice
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: Had ours for a year. Only used in bedroom for a couple of hours. Last night we smelled a slight burn smell when we turned TV on then it went black. Was surprised because no warning and had seemed like ok for money till now.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad TV
Reviews.Author: Ben Henderson
Reviews.Content: I've had mine about a year now and as far as I can tell it's a fine product for the price. Would buy again if I could go back and do it over.Pros: Picture quality is just fine for me. I'm no expert but I don't have any problems with it.  Still works.Cons:Internal speakers rattle a bit at higher volume and I get a strange humming when I plug my external speakers into it.Overall good for the price. I have my speakers plugged into my computer and an hdmi running to my tv so my sound gets routed through my external speakers instead of the tv. If you can put up with that then you'll be pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: I'm Blown Away....This is for the X325BV-FMDR
Reviews.Author: I'm The Metal Lord
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely blown away by the quality of this item at this price point. Yes it's a no name brand and yes it's quite possible I may need to replace this sooner rather than later and but of course if you read any other reviews you know the sound isn't top notch HOWEVER the sound isn't near as bad as I expected from reading other reviews.If you go into the sound menu there is even an EQ with presets of rock, pop, jazz and user (100, 250, 500, 1k, 2k, 4k and 10k) as well as your basic bass and treble and balance controls. This allows you to tweak the sound the way you like it. Not to mention the basic sound settings with presets they have already (Dynamic, Standard, Soft, and user) I simply plugged in my computer surround sound speakers into the headset jack and the sound is above average but I did mess around with the sound before I added the speakers and it was passable and not as bad as expected.The picture quality on this is A MAZE ING! I have a 48" Sanyo in my living room and I bought this to be a TV, PC, and Xbox Monitor in my office/bedroom. Those that feel a 32" monitor is too large for a PC monitor don't know how to adjust the settings on their PC. I actually have 2 PC's hook up to it. One is personal and the other is for my work at home job. If I ever have to go back to using a smaller screen for work I think I would.....well I'm sure it will never come to that since I'll just buy me another one. It is so nice to have multiple windows open and easily accessible of all different sizes on my screen. So nice to sit back and work without having to be right up on my monitor. On the personal side I love using my wireless keyboard (I bought a Logitech K400) with Multi Touch Touchpad to operate all my browsing/movie watching that I do from my PC. And for the Xbox 360 it's perfect for gaming at 1080p. Not to mention the picture quality while watching TV. Now I'll be honest most feed from cable companies are not at 1080p BUT if you are like me you can access your cable channels through your PC or gaming console and there you get full 1080p on every channel. I only use the TV tuner when I'm getting ready to fall asleep and set the sleep timer.Having 3 HDMI inputs was one of the main reasons I bought this model but everything else has been great as well. For instance the different settings that are available for the picture size is PERFECT! You have full 100%, normal, wide, cinema and zoom. Depending on the source I have used full, normal and cinema so far but I can imagine a need for all of them.This TV has so many different settings and tweaks I couldn't even imagine talking about all of them here but I will mention a few others that I haven't mentioned yet. Blue or black background when no source. Auto off when no source. Internal digital tuner. Parental settings. Date and time. Five picture modes (power saving, vivid, standard, mild and user. Color temperature. Noise reduction. Just to name a few.If you are even considering this for TV or PC or gaming console and haven't bought it yet you should add to your cart now and pick it up before they run out.

Reviews.Title: tv for my son
Reviews.Author: Anthony S. Brown
Reviews.Content: My son loves his tv. He uses it for his xbox and computer screen. It's not to big or small but perfect for him.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, Sound is Weak
Reviews.Author: Robert M.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV during Black Friday in 2012, it's been over a year and still works fine. It was a great deal at $179. The sound on it isn't very good but I just have it connected to my Big Jambox and it works beautifully.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Michael Berns
Reviews.Content: The headline says it all.  We put this TV in our bedroom, so we aren't expecting much to begin with, but the picture and the sound are what you'd expect from such a cheap TV.That said, if you're not relying on this to be your main TV, you can't really go wrong with it, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: drew constable
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV over a year now. I absolutely love it.  GREAT low-end model.  Perfect for college kids.

Reviews.Title: TV went out in less than a year!
Reviews.Author: Big T
Reviews.Content: The TV stopped working after 10 months of lite use being in our guest bedroom(used maybe once a month so a total of 10 times). I am in the process of trying to get the warranty service done on it. I am actually writing this review while on live chat with Sceptre. You can not talk to a live person, you can only leave a voicemail or do live chat, at least that is what i have found after trying to call them 5 times, once a day Monday thru Friday. It has been a 2 week process so far to send the TV back to them, so just a warning that when the TV does break it will be a process to get it repaired/replaced. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: I AM MORE THAN PLEASED WITH MY SCEPTRE
Reviews.Author: lois purvee
Reviews.Content: IT HAS A PERFECT PICTURE AND SOUND IS ATTRACTIVE I AM GLAD I BOUGHT IT AND WOULD RECOMMEND IT HIGHLY

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PICTURE AND LOOKS GOOD
Reviews.Author: Bill Hodges
Reviews.Content: The HDTV was easy to install and looks good in a bedroom mounted on the wall of our bedroom.  It is an excellent size that can be seen easily in our bed.

Reviews.Title: Wouldnt buy again, OK for smaller rooms. Speakers are the weak point!
Reviews.Author: Stephan
Reviews.Content: TV will turn itself off after some hours to save energy but its annoying to be honest. Cant figure out how to turn it off. Definitely not good to be used as a monitor. The built in speakers drone under higher volumes and certain frequencies the system itself lacks a lot of volume as well.Not sure if the speaker bar that is optional will make a difference but the common knowledge of "weak speakers with flat screens" applies to this tv for sure.

Reviews.Title: SCEPTE X325BV-FHD
Reviews.Author: JM FRASIER
Reviews.Content: WENT OUT AFTER 6 MONTHS OF USING THIS TV. SENT TO SCEPTRE TO REPAIR, HAD TO LOCATE A UPS, THEY WOULD NOT PICKUP FROM MY HOME, I REALLY WAS DISAPPOINTED HOW THIS ITEM WENT OUT SO SOON, SCEPTRE NEVER SAID WHAT THE PROBLEM WAS.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, while it works.
Reviews.Author: Dale Duke
Reviews.Content: My experience with this Sceptre television was wonderful for about 9 months, until the sound decided to quit. I can still watch Television but having absolutely no sound ruins any good tv. Considering this is my only tv I'm out of one until I can pay for a new one. Really sucks knowing such a good computer monitor company can't make a decent TV. Then again I guess you don't have to focus on sound for a computer monitor.. If the sound would still work I would give it 5 Stars.

Reviews.Title: Died ten months later
Reviews.Author: JHoffart
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television during a Black Friday sale from Amazon last year. It was of decent quality, with good picture and sound that is a bit tinny and cuts out during sudden increases in pitch. Overall, an average television, which is expected given the price. However, about three weeks ago it stopped working regularly. When I press the power button, the red light turns blue, which signifies power on. The problem is that the picture doesn't always show up, and the power button on the remote and the unit itself will not turn the television off. You have to unplug it, then hope it works. It's not uncommon for it to take at least five times to finally work. I would not purchase this product again. If you do, spend the $20 on a better warranty.Update - 10/25/13 - The manufacturer agreed to replace my unit. This sounded like great news, but I've now come to realize that their service is every bit as bad as their manufacturing standards. I requested a box and was told that I could expect delivery within 5-8 business days. Well, that was a lie, as they didn't even bother to ship the box until the seventh business day. I can now expect delivery on the 29th, which will make it a full eleven business days. I've asked customer service about this, but received only a very short message detailing the date the box was sent and a confirmation number. To make matters slightly worse, the email reads like it was typed by a child and the confirmation number was given without instruction. Luckily, I didn't have trouble figuring that out, but there might be a lot of people that lack the online familiarity to complete the task without some assistance. This company is just appalling overall and I would recommend that you stay far away from their products, which I would now give zero stars if I was allowed.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: C. Schotter "Bella"
Reviews.Content: TV crapped out just after the return period. Can't return it. It's an expensive paperweight.$200 DOWN THE DRAIN. Ugh.

To switch inputs you have to hit "input" then scroll up/down, then select. Not a big deal unless you are using it with a universal remote like a harmony. When it has to switch inputs it kicks off a macro that has to do each of those steps individually which takes a while, and one signal doesn't make it to the TV it throws off the remote. Reviews.Title: Great TV, but have an alternative for sound.
Reviews.Author: Robert Cook
Reviews.Content: The picture of this tv is on par with higher end brands such as sony and samsung, it has a extremely crisp and clear 1080p picture, and works well as a pc monitor as well, however mine had a Improperly set EDID, as such it would tend to scale the pc screen(even if scaling is turned off in settings), causing blurry and distorted text, this is only a problem when using HDMI on the pc and with nvidia graphics cards, as AMD cards have an option to ignore EDID should the need arise, nvidia refuses to implement a fix themselves.This is not a problem over VGA, only HDMI, and will only effect pc input, game systems, blu-ray/dvd players and tv will not be effected..Also, EDID mismatching is extremely uncommon on newer tv's, i just got the one that had an improperly set edid, so this should not effect your purchase and is more of a reason why it's 4 stars as well as some helpful advice if someone runs into the issue themselves.If you have this issue on this TV (or any video input device for that matter, even home theatre systems and computer monitors can have this issue), google EDID mismatch fix, it is fixable, but you will need to lose sound over HDMI from the pc to fix it, on nvidia graphics cards at least.I bought this tv fully expecting bad sound, and i got what i expected, that said i run my sound through my pc's sound card anyway, so this was moot at best for me.The headphone jack will have a whine  with it if you do not have a powered sound device, the headphone jack should not be labeled a headphone jack as most headphones receive power from the headphone jack these days.If you wish to use headphones, purchase a rca male to 3.5mm female cable, they are usually 1-2$ and will work as a headphone jack fine, however as has been said, this tv is not the best for sound, while perfect for a 1080P tv screen, the sound is lackluster, even over headphones, while bearable, if your an audiophile this will get to you.All said, i am happy with my purchase, if it was not for the EDID issue and the sound i would have given it 5 stars, however i must subtract half a star for each as i have workarounds for both, if i did not, this tv would be a 3 star tv, but with such a amazing picture quality, i cannot help but love this tv.If the sound issue doesn't bother you (or your not an audiophile), then i would highly suggest this tv.

The tv came with 3 dead pixels.  1 i was able to get out.  1 is completely dead and the last one is stuck on red. I felt none of this was worth returning over as i dont notice it from my viewing distance. The speakers are hit and miss.  While they arent great,  they are more than adequate depending on the source.  When the Tv was receiving digital audio,  the sound was more than adequate for my 12x13 room.  When it is analog audio,  its mediocre at best.  It really is liked night and day.The speakers are aim downwards.  had they been aimed at the wall, it would probably sounded better.  I ended up purchasing a samsung soundbar to compensate.  the stand is a joke as well.  It uses 4 screws(2xtype 1,2xtype2) to old the base to the tv.  The screw are either wrong or threaded improperly because the type 1 screws i couldnt get in for the life of me.  I wall mounted it anyway, but worth mentioning.  Its also fairly thick.  i bout a very low profile mount and from the wall to the front of the tv is 4.5 in.  It has a good number of hook ups that are all placed appropriately to make wall mounting easier.  it has a glossing black finish that scratches quite easily as well. The tv serves my purpose well.  just dont use this for your main setup as you will probably be dissappointed.
